column4: how can i get a pack of codecs so i can play realaudio and other non-standard audio formats?
is there an apt-get i could do?
the add-remove programs is useless
http://www.medibuntu.org/
thanks
what do i do?
read the HowTo page
of course. thank you. :>
ok, so i added the repositories, now how do i install the codecs?
Did you add them manually, or through Synaptic?
i did the commands you use to add the repositories, just copied & pasted. the sudo wget and stuff...
ok, have you done "sudo apt-get update" yet? of not, do that
done
i didn't realize i wasn't searching 'all open source' in synaptic. so i found the gstreamer. will those help?

You can install any of the packages listed at http://www.medibuntu.org/packages.php now by typing "sudo apt-get install <package>, or, if you want to browse, by using System > Administration > Synaptic Package Manager
Add/Remove lists the popular common packages; Synaptic lists *all* packages available in the repositories you have enabled
ahhh, got it. now, will the 'gstreamer' audio codec(s) in add/remove work for playing real audio in the default movie player?
which is 'totem'
It's so long since I did that I don't remember :p
but something sure installs them :)
thanks for all your help, sorry to bother you
